Projects

Benefitfocus

Web Development

My first Drupal project was a doozy. This reputable benefits management software company required an equally reputable website, complete with a sleek User Interface, built to drive lead generation and tell a story. The website is fully responsive and is referenced as a leading source for content in the Benefits Industry.

Take a Look

Benefitfocus Media

Branded Web Application

The challenge of developing an application that was simplistic from a content manager's perspective, and yet beautiful from a user's occurred in this project posed by the Media team at Benefitfocus. Their clients needed a way to send employees branded videos and video collections in order to train, update, or educate them on an array of issues. Using Drupal, I was able to satisfy both parties concerns.

Kate Mcdonald

Web Development

My friends at Cobble Hill gave me the pleasure of developing this stunningly designed eCommerce website. This Wordpress site is a favorite of mine not only because it was one of my first professionally contracted projects, but because of how unique and challenging the design was to build.

Commish

Web Development

Commish is an app designed to schedule and officiate Recreational Sports, also known as pick-up games. The app was submitted as my final project for the Iron Yard.

Web Development

Sendsay is a chat application dedicated to the martial arts master, Bruce Lee.

Stage

Web Development

Stage uses a detailed API to list all local concerts in the Charleston area. The app then allows the user to edit their own calendar with events they are planning to attend.

Powell Peralta Contest

Web Development

This single page site was my entry in a contest held by a digital marketing agency here in Charleston. The project was based around a single mock-up that each student was tasked with re-creating. We had a blast.
